data.title: Warnings over scale of Amazon rainforest fires ignored by President Bolsonaro

data.text:
The Brazilian government was told this month that fires deliberately started by farmers as a demonstration in support of land clearing could lead to environmental devastation but failed to act, according to a leaked document.

The letter from the federal prosecutor’s office, dated August 7, alerted officials at the environment agency Ibama to a planned “day of fire”, beginning three days later in the state of Para. Farmers had announced in a local newspaper they would set fire to cleared land “to show the president we want to work”. Prosecutors warned that the action could “get out of control”.
